titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Louise Pearce papers, Rockefeller University Faculty FA188
titlestmt.author: Ruth Sternfeld

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-03-07 00:23:27 -0500.

did.unittitle: Louise Pearce papers, Rockefeller University Faculty

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Louise Pearce, 1885-1959 physician and medical researcher was connected with The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research from 1913 when she came as a fellow. She remained at the Institute and advanced to Associate Member from which position she retired in 1951. She was a key figure in developing the drug tryparsamide to control African sleeping sickness for which she received the King Leopold II prize of $10,000 and was made an officer of the Royal Order of the Lion. She worked closely with Dr. Wade Brown and their accomplishments included the discovery of the Brown-Pearce carcinoma a rabbit cancer and also the virus cause of rabbit pox. In 1935 she moved her laboratory to the Department of Plant and Animal Pathology at Princeton where after Dr. Brown's death she finished up the work he had started on constitution.
Additional biographical material about Louise Pearce is located in a folder in the Archives office bio file.

bioghist.p: Member of: American Medical Women's Association (Member of Executive Board), AAAS member, New York Academy of Medicine, Harvey Society, American Society for Experimental Pathology, American Association of University Women (1945-1951 Director), American Society for Pharmacology and Experimental Therapeutics, American Association of Pathologists and Bacteriologists, Society for Experimental Biology and Medicine, American Association for Cancer Research, New York Society of Tropical Medicine, Johns Hopkins Surgical and Medical Association, American Society of Tropical Medicine, College of Physicians of Philadelphia, Pathology Society (Great Britain and Ireland), Royal Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene, British Society for Study of Venereal Disease (honorary), Société belge de médecine tropicale (corresponding) , Peiping Society of Natural History Phi Beta Kappa, Sigma Xi, Alpha Omega Alpha, Order of the Crown (Belgium — honorary), Cosmopolitan Club

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists primarily of administrative correspondence, a folder of scattered biographical material and photographs, bibliography and five volumes of Collected Reprints.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The papers of Louise Pearce Were deposited with the Rockefeller University Archives on her death by the administration.
Box 1, Folders 4-6 were added to the collection in June 1980 by the Rockefeller University Faculty Records Office.
Box 1, Folders 7-10 were added to the collection in February 1987 by Lila J. Magie.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Ruth Sternfeld processed box 1, folders 1-3, and 5 volumes in April, 1979.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted pending permission from Rockefeller University.

did.unittitle: Who's Who photocopy
Excerpt from Minutes of Board of Scientific Directors
Newspaper clippings
Correspondence, photographs and "Extraits" du Bulletin de l'Institut Royal Colonial Belge dealing with award of Leopold II and conferring of Officer of the Royal Order of the Lion
Copy of news article and letter from grateful patient Newspaper obituaries
RIMR News release for obituaries
Photographs
Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence dealing with application as a fellow at The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research which includes handwritten letters from Louise Pearce as well as recommendations from W.H. Howell and Lewellys F. Barker and letter concurring in appointment from Theodore Janeway. Also included is 1920-21 correspondence regarding maps prepared by the National Research Council on tropical diseases and sanitation in the African colonies.

did.unittitle: Reports on progress in use of tryparsamide
Letter of evaluation (handwritten) by W.H. Brown to Simon Flexner
Administrative correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Dealing with leave of absence Mar.-Oct. 1931 to visit European Universities and plans for year, 1931-1932 at Peking Union Medical College and the work to be carried on while there.
Includes correspondence dealing with tryparsamide supplied to certain clinics in Germany under the direction of specific clinicians.

did.unittitle: Correspondence and employed record of Margaret Dunham
Pottier, R. and van den Branden, F. Note on sujet du tryparsamide ou tryponarsyl. "Annales de la Société belge de médecine tropicale." 13 (1933)

Correspondence between Simon Flexner and Louise Pearce during time at Peking Union Medical College. Also includes correspondence dealing with space and budgets on return and bills for animals shipped to Institute from China
Correspondence regarding the rental of a house in Princeton and routine administrative correspondence dealing with budgetary arrangements and completion of Wade Brown work on constitution
Employed record of Margaret Dunham who returned to New York City laboratories
Collected Reprints
Correspondence and article

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Additions to the papers by Faculty Records Office June 1980.

did.unittitle: Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists mainly of correspondence with Margaret Dunham after the death of Dr. Pearce in 1959, and correspondence Dr. Paul A. Rosahn regarding an analysis of the material on malignancy which had been collected by Dr. Pearce and not evaluated at the time of her death.

did.unittitle: Article

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Carbon copy of the two part article left incomplete at the time of Dr. Pearce's death but which was revised enough so that it was published in JOURNAL OF EXPERIMENTAL MEDICINE, 111 (1960) 810-830.

did.unittitle: Simon Flexner/Pearce administrative correspondence

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Addition to the collection, found in inactive files of the RU Corporate Secretary/Faculty Administrator, rec'd Feb 1987 from Lila J. Magie.
